item.title: Automatic Differentiation of Programs with Discrete Randomness
item.description: Automatic differentiation (AD) has become ubiquitous throughout scientific computing and deep learning. However, AD systems have been restricted to the subset of programs that have a continuous dependence on parameters. Programs that have discrete stochastic behaviors governed by distribution parameters, such as flipping a coin with probability p of being heads, pose a challenge to these systems. In this work we develop a new AD methodology for programs with discrete randomness. We demonstrate how this method gives an unbiased and low-variance estimator.
